article.title: Modus Operandi Awarded U.S. Army Contract for Service-Oriented Architecture Migration
article.author: Katie Packard
article.text: Modus Operandi has been awarded a two-year, $730,000 contract by the U.S. Army to improve its ability to migrate critical software algorithms to more modern systems. The Phase II Small Business Innovation Research contract was awarded by the U.S. Army Communications-Electronics Life Cycle Management Command Software Engineering Center and Research, Development and Engineering Command Center at Fort Monmouth, New Jersey.
